p: Global genomic ancestry tools can be categorised as shown in (Figure S1) (Table S1). Whilst STRUCTURE was initially the most popular approach, it suffered from several disadvantages. First, its accuracy and reliability have been a source of concern [ 141, 142]. When the diversity of the native population is low, STRUCTURE was shown to produce particularly misleading results [ 142]. Finally, STRUCTURE is a notoriously slow tool, which was soon replaced by dramatically faster implementations.
